article.headline: Evansville 69, Valparaiso 64
article.story: EVANSVILLE, Ind. (AP) -- Matt Webster scored 30 points and grabbed seven rebounds to lead Evansville to a 69-64 win over Valparaiso on Tuesday night. Jason Holsinger added eight points and nine assists for the Aces (5-3). Webster was 15-of-16 from the free-throw line and Evansville had 33 free throw attempts compared to Valparaiso's nine. Brandon McPherson scored 18 points on 7-of-8 shooting for Valparaiso (3-5). Evansville trailed 29-26 at halftime and shot just 30 percent in the first half. The Aces hit 19-of-24 free throws in the second half and went on an 11-6 run over the final 4:03 to secure the victory. The Crusaders lost their fifth straight game despite shooting 25-of-49 (51 percent) from the floor and outrebounding the Aces 34-31. Valparaiso had 24 turnovers, which Evansville turned into 31 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
